title: What extra activities will help me get into the Air Force Academy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi Tyler, thanks for asking. If you haven’t done so already, please take some time to review the Air Force Academy Admissions website. On there, make sure you check out the Extracurricular Activities page, which will tell you, among other things: Participation in a variety of athletic and non-athletic high school activities is an asset in preparing for the demanding Air Force Academy program, and is a competitive factor in your application to the Academy. Sustained participation and leadership in a few activities is desirable. Remember, they are looking for sustained participation in a few activities. You don’t need to do a hundred activities. You just need to do a few, consistently, and show leadership in that activity. The Academy is looking for people with demonstrated leadership potential and the ability to succeed in a high-stress academic, athletic, and military environment. Showing high academic achievement as well as sustained participation and leadership in a few extracurricular activities will achieve that goal. Also, if you have not reached out to your Admissions Liaison Officer (ALO), do so. If you don’t know who your ALO is, find him or her and reach out. They will help with the entire admissions process. Good luck!

I know a lot of people who attended the USAF Academy and others who attended West Point or Annapolis. This is what I think of: Boy Scout or Girl Scout earning nearly the highest honors in their regionCross country regional champion or a top varsity athlete that has assisted in Leading her/his team to VictoryThrough all of that, decent publicity in your state so the staff of your Congressperson or Senator will recognize your name as you Require a nomination from one of those three unless you personally know the Vice President of the USA or one of your parents was a Congressional Medal of Honor receipientYou must be among the Best of the Best. All the best.
